com.ephesoft.dcma.batch.encryption.util

Class DOMEncryptionUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ephesoft.dcma.batch.encryption.util.DOMEncryptionUtil

  • public class DOMEncryptionUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility to encrypt and decrypt the DOM Objects. It provides an external interface to crypt the Document object and provide the same to the external interface.

    This utility class will help in exporting DOM objects of the encrypted XML files in the decrypted form. This interface wil help the Scripting/Export Plugin's to work without any hurdle

    Version:
    1.0.
    Author:
    Ephesoft

    • Method Detail

      • encryptDocument

        public static void encryptDocument(org.jdom.Document document,
                   PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm encryptionAlgorithm,
                   byte[] encryptionKey)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Encrypt's the Document object recursively on the basis of encryptionAlgorithm as well as on the basis of the encryption key.

        Encrypt's each and every element under the document. It uses the same scheme as used throughout the XML encrypt

        Parameters:
        document - Document The object to be encrypted.
        encryptionAlgorithm - PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm algorithm on the basis of which the data needs to be encrypted
        encryptionKey - byte[] The key which is responsible to encrypt/decrypt the data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the Document could not be encrypted.

      • encryptElementTextRecursively

        public static void encryptElementTextRecursively(org.jdom.Element domElement,
                                 PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm encryptionAlgorithm,
                                 byte[] encryptionKey)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Encrypt's the Element and the subelement's under the DOM Element. This API recursively Encrypt's the content DOM element.
        Parameters:
        domElement - Element which needs to be encrypted.
        encryptionAlgorithm - PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm encryptionAlgorithm on the basis of which encryption needs to be done.
        encryptionKey - key which is responsible to actually encrypt/decrypt the data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - When the Element cannot be encrypted.

      • decryptDocument

        public static void decryptDocument(org.jdom.Document document,
                   PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm encryptionAlgorithm,
                   byte[] encryptionKey)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Decrypt's the Document object recursively on the basis of encryptionAlgorithm as well as on the basis of the encryption key.

        Decrypt's each and every element under the document. It uses the same scheme as used throughout the XML encrypt

        Parameters:
        document - Document The object to be encrypted.
        encryptionAlgorithm - PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm algorithm on the basis of which the data needs to be encrypted
        encryptionKey - byte[] The key which is responsible to encrypt/decrypt the data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the Document could not be encrypted.

      • decryptElementTextRecursively

        public static void decryptElementTextRecursively(org.jdom.Element domElement,
                                 PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm encryptionAlgorithm,
                                 byte[] encryptionKey)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Decrypt's the Element and the subelement's under the DOM Element. This API recursively decrypt's the content DOM element.
        Parameters:
        domElement - Element which needs to be decrypted.
        encryptionAlgorithm - PrivateKeyEncryptionAlgorithm encryptionAlgorithm on the basis of which decryption needs to be done.
        encryptionKey - key which is responsible to actually encrypt/decrypt the data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - When the Element cannot be encrypted.
